cities.name: Dubrovnik

spring.description: Pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds make spring ideal for sightseeing.

summer.description: Major cultural festival with theater, music, and performances across historic locations.

autumn.description: Warm sea, softer light, and fewer visitors.

winter.description: Peaceful streets and authentic local life without crowds.

public_transport_tips.tip: Local buses connect the Old City with Lapad, Gru≈æ, and viewpoints.

city_events.name: Dubrovnik Summer Festival
city_events.description: Prestigious cultural festival with performances in historic venues.

places.name: Rector‚Äôs Palace

hidden_gems.name: Early-morning Stradun
hidden_gems.description: Quiet stone street before crowds arrive.

hidden_gems.name: Backstreets of the Old City
hidden_gems.description: Authentic local life away from main routes.

cities.name: Pula

interests.name: Pula Arena
interests.description: One of the best-preserved Roman amphitheaters in the world and the main symbol of Pula.

interests.name: Temple of Augustus
interests.description: Ancient Roman temple located in the central Forum, dedicated to Emperor Augustus.

interests.name: Forum Square
interests.description: Main public square since Roman times, surrounded by historic buildings and caf√©s.

interests.name: Verudela Peninsula
interests.description: Coastal area with beaches, walking paths, and clear Adriatic waters.

interests.name: Ka≈°tel (Pula Citadel)
interests.description: Hilltop Venetian fortress offering panoramic views over the city and harbor.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Istrian specialties such as fu≈æi pasta, truffles (seasonal), seafood, prosciutto, and olive oil. Local Malvasia wine pairs well with most dishes.

spring.description: Mild weather and blooming landscapes make sightseeing comfortable.

summer.description: Renowned film festival held in the Roman Arena.

autumn.description: Autumn brings truffle hunting and food festivals in the region.

winter.description: Quiet city atmosphere with local life and culture.

public_transport_tips.tip: Local buses connect the city center with beaches and suburbs.
Pula Airport offers seasonal international flights.
The old town is compact and easy to explore on foot.

city_events.name: Pula Film Festival
city_events.description: Historic Croatian film festival held in the Roman Arena.

places.name: Arch of the Sergii
places.description: Triumphal Roman arch marking the entrance to the old town.

places.name: Pula Aquarium (Fort Verudela)
places.description: Aquarium housed in a historic Austro-Hungarian fort.

cities.name: Split

spring.description: Warm but not hot, perfect for walking and sightseeing.

summer.description: Open-air concerts, theater, and cultural events in historic venues.

autumn.description: Warm sea, fewer crowds, and softer light.

winter.description: Mild winters with calm streets and local life.

public_transport_tips.tip: The old town and waterfront are best explored on foot.
Local buses connect Split with beaches and suburbs.
Ferries connect Split with nearby islands like Braƒç and Hvar.

city_events.name: Split Summer Festival
city_events.description: Annual festival featuring music, theater, and dance in historic locations.

places.name: Bacvice Beach

places.name: Split Archaeological Museum
places.description: One of the oldest museums in Croatia, focusing on Roman Dalmatia.

hidden_gems.name: Early-morning Peristyle
hidden_gems.description: Quiet Roman square before crowds arrive.

cities.name: Zadar

interests.name: Sea Organ
interests.description: Unique architectural installation that creates music using sea waves and wind.

interests.name: Greeting to the Sun
interests.description: Large solar-powered light installation that produces colorful light displays after sunset.

interests.name: Old Town Zadar
interests.description: Historic peninsula filled with Roman ruins, medieval churches, and lively squares.

interests.name: St. Donatus Church
interests.description: Iconic 9th-century pre-Romanesque church and symbol of Zadar.

interests.name: Roman Forum
interests.description: Ancient Roman forum located next to St. Donatus Church.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Dalmatian seafood, black risotto, grilled fish, Pag cheese, maraschino liqueur, and local olive oil.

full_day.Morning: Start exploring the Old Town ‚òÄÔ∏è, visiting the Church of St. Donatus üèõÔ∏è and the Roman Forum.

spring.description: Mild temperatures and blooming greenery around the peninsula.

summer.description: Open-air concerts and lively seaside atmosphere.

autumn.description: Warm sea, fewer crowds, and beautiful sunsets.

winter.description: Calm atmosphere with local life and mild weather.

public_transport_tips.tip: The Old Town peninsula is best explored on foot.
Local buses connect Zadar with beaches and nearby towns.
Ferries connect Zadar with islands like Ugljan and Dugi Otok.

city_events.name: Zadar Summer Theatre
city_events.description: Open-air cultural performances in historic locations.

places.name: Zadar Cathedral (St. Anastasia)
places.description: Largest cathedral in Dalmatia with a notable bell tower.

places.name: Museum of Ancient Glass
places.description: Museum showcasing Roman glass artifacts and live demonstrations.

hidden_gems.name: Early-morning waterfront
hidden_gems.description: Peaceful sounds of the Sea Organ with no crowds.

hidden_gems.name: Quiet alleys of Old Town
hidden_gems.description: Authentic local atmosphere away from main paths.

cities.name: Zagreb

interests.name: Ban Jelaƒçiƒá Square

interests.name: Upper Town (Gornji Grad)

spring.description: Blooming parks and lively terraces throughout the city.

summer.description: Open-air cinema, concerts, and festivals across the city.

winter.description: Award-winning Christmas markets and festive city atmosphere.

public_transport_tips.tip: Trams are the fastest way to move around the city.
The city center is compact and walkable.
Zagreb has excellent rail and bus connections to other Croatian cities.

city_events.name: Advent in Zagreb
city_events.description: Christmas markets, concerts, and festive decorations throughout the city.

places.name: Museum of Broken Relationships
